page.title: 11Landscape Giggleswick Parish
page.content: This is a rural landscape and the buildings are mainly related to the needs of the farming community. Farm buildings are built of local stone, Millstone Grit and the farm houses are built in the traditional Dales style i.e. with stone mullions in the windows and decorated doorheads (see slide C). Another feature is the Venetian window. The fields are all surrounded by dry stone walls. The area has a few typical stone-built barns scattered around the fields away from the farmsteads, for cattle and fodder during the winter. There is a Millstone Grit outcrop of rock known as Black Bank (see slide A).
